articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Pyong Ryul
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Pyong Ryul
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Pyong Ryul, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and advisor to the Supreme Court, to express deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Work at Pukchang Thermal-power Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Work at Pukchang Thermal-power Complex
						
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made field survey of the work at the Pukchang Thermal-power Complex.
					The premier looked round different places of the complex before holding a consultative meeting.
					
					The meeting underscored the need for the officials to bring about innovations by meticulously organizing and commanding the production in keeping with high zeal of the workers, deeply aware of the important duty to be performed by the complex for power production. 
					
					It, at the same time, took measures to ensure that relevant domains increase their roles.
					
					Then a consultative meeting of officials took place at the Jenam Coal Mine of the Tokchon Area Coal Mining Complex to supply coal to the Pukchang Thermal-power Complex.
					
					The meeting called for carrying out the monthly and quarter yearly plans for coal production without fail to contribute to increasing the power production and the improvement of the people's living standard. It also took necessary measures.
					
					Earlier, the premier convened a consultative meeting at the Sunchon Chemical Complex to discuss the issue of keeping its production going at a high rate and measures to be implemented by the relevant units to ensure the supply of necessary raw and other materials.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets South African Government Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets South African Government Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Tuesday met and had a friendly talk with the South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Greetings to Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Overseas Compatriots of Guinea
articles.content:
Greetings to Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Overseas Compatriots of Guinea
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Francois Lonseny Fall, minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Overseas Compatriots of Guinea, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Guinea.
					 The message expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger thanks to their common efforts and wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Portuguese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Portuguese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Antonio Quinteiro Nobre, Portuguese ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Kim had a talk with the ambassador after receiving it.

articles.title: Delegation of University of Sports of Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of University of Sports of Japan Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Nippon Sport Science University headed by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Nippon Sport Science University visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 They laid a floral basket and made a bow before their statues in reverence for the peerlessly great men who performed undying exploits before the era and history.

articles.title: South African Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
South African Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The members of the delegation paid high tribute to the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the hall where the Generalissimos lie in state the guests made a bow to them.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and the halls that house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book that the great leaders of the Korean people devoted their lives to achieving the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese government economic delegation headed by Nguyen Cam Tu, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce, on Tuesday visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The members of the delegation went round with keen interest historical relics preserved with much care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the brilliant revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic life of his Mangyongdae family.
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said that the President was born into a revolutionary family and nurtured patriotism. The President devoted his whole life to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness, he noted.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Arch of Triumph, Rungna Dolphinarium, etc.

articles.title: Credentials to Brazilian President
articles.content:
Credentials to Brazilian President
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Thae Jong, DPRK ambassador to Brazil, presented his credentials to Brazilian President Dilma Vana Rousseff on October 31.
					 The president hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK, China Sign MOU on Cooperation between Prosecutors Offices
articles.content:
DPRK, China Sign MOU on Cooperation between Prosecutors Offices 
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- A MOU on cooperation between the DPRK Supreme Public Prosecutors Office and the Supreme People's Procuratorate of China was signed in Beijing.
					 It was inked by Ri Chol, first vice director of the DPRK office, and Hu Zejun, executive deputy chief procurator of the Chinese procuratorate.

articles.title: Reception Given for Japanese Guests
articles.content:
Reception Given for Japanese Guests 
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-Japan Friendship Association hosted a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Tuesday in honor of Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan, and his party and the delegation of the Nippon Sport Science University.
					 Present there on invitation were Kanji Inoki who is also chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association, a specified non-profit undertaking corporation of Japan, and his party, and members of the delegation headed by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is advisor to the association, Kim Song Nam, vice-department director of the C.C.,  the WPK, Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Sin Tong Gyu, rector of Korea University of Physical Education, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Kim Yong Il hailed the conclusion of the agreement on the establishment of the Pyongyang representative office between the association and the Sports Peace Community Association, a specified non-profit undertaking corporation of Japan.
					
					 He underscored the will to boost the contact and exchange with Japanese figures in the future.
					
					 Kenshiro Matsunami wished Marshal Kim Jong Un good health.
					
					 He expressed hope that the delegation's visit to the DPRK would mark an occasion in establishing friendly relations between Japan and the DPRK.

articles.title: Kaesong-Ryongthong Temple-Pakyon Ring Road Built in DPRK
articles.content:
Kaesong-Ryongthong Temple-Pakyon Ring Road Built in DPRK
						
 Kaesong, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kaesong-Ryongthong Temple-Pakyon ring road was built in the DPRK.
					 Kaesong boasts its ancient history as the capital city of Koryo (918-1392), the first unified state in Korea which existed nearly for 500 years.
					
					 There are in Kaesong the Mausoleum of King Wang Kon (the first reign), the Mausoleum of King Kong Min(31st reign), Sungyang School, Phyochung Monuments, Sonjuk Bridge, Koryo Songgyunkwan, Manwol Pavilion, Kaesong Chomsongdae Observatory, Ryongthong Temple and other historical sites, Pakyon Falls and other scenic spots.
					
					  On display at Ryongthong Temple are Buddhist Goddess of Mercy, Sakyamuni and other large Buddha, Buddhist pictures, gold-printed paintings, landscape paintings and ceramic works, etc.  
					
					  Pakyon Falls 37m high and 1.5m wide in Pakyon-ri is known as one of the three major famous water falls along with Kuryong Falls in Mt. Kumgang and Taesung Falls in Mt. Solak.
					
					 The building of the ring road makes it possible to provide people with better conditions for cultural and emotional life.

articles.title: 24th National Software Contest, Exhibition Close
articles.content:
24th National Software Contest, Exhibition Close
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The 24th national software contest and exhibition were closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Monday. They were opened on October 29.
					 The contest and exhibition involved a competition in programs for English-Korean and Chinese-Korean translation and programs for simulation of sports games, IT exchange and program services.
					
					 In the exhibition of computerization of operations at ministries and national institutions the Ministry of Finance took the special place and the Ministry of Post and Telecommunications, the Ministry of Light Industry, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport, the Ministry of Public Health and the State Commission of Quality Management took the first place.
					
					 In the field of industrial establishments Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Inspection and Quarantine Station for Exports and Imports of North Phyongan Province and the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex were highly appreciated. 
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology took the special place and more than 130 programs presented by Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, the Central Information Agency for Science and Technology, Huichon University of Technology and other units proved successful at the program exhibition. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Information Technology Bureau and Kim Chaek University of Technology placed first in the contest of programs for translation. The tele-education system "Ryongnamsan" from Kim Il Sung University and its two other programs took the first place in the contest of programs for tele-education. Programs presented by Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, the Academy of Sports Science, Kim Chaek University of Technology and other units came first in various program contests. 
					
					 Competitions of programs included competition of the latest programs and competition of program introduction. Programs presented by Kim Il Sung University, the Industrial Information Research Center of the State Academy of Sciences, etc. came first in the competitions. 
					
					 Pyongyang City and South Hamgyong Province took the first place in the provincial standing of the contest and exhibition. 
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Jae Song, minister of Electronics Industry, officials concerned and program developers.
					
					 Silk banners, certificates of registration of programs and medals and prizes were awarded to the successful units and participants.
					
					 Choe Sang Gon, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, made a closing address.

articles.title: Premier Soccer League Matches Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Premier Soccer League Matches Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Men's and women's premier soccer league matches took place in Pyongyang in October as part of the DPRK Championships.
					 Competing in the men's league were ten teams including April 25, Hwaebul and Mangyongbong and in the women's league 12 teams including April 25, Amnokgang and Myohyangsan.
					
					 The titles in the league matches were taken by men and women of the April 25 team, with results of five wins, three draws and one defeat in nine matches for the men's event and nine wins and two draws in eleven matches for the women's event.
					
					 Mangyongbong and Amnokgang came second in men's and women's events respectively, while Hwaebul and Myohyangsan third.
					
					 The matches were held on a round-robin basis, and a total of 299 goals were made in 45 men's and 66 women's matches, an average of 2.6 scores per match.
					
					 So Hyon Uk and Kwon Song Hwa of April 25 were selected to be best man and woman players, O Jin Hyok of Hwaebul and Ra Un Sim of Amnokgang top scorers and Ri Kang of April 25 and Choe Kum Ju of Ponghwasan best goal-keepers. And the prize of morality went to the men's team of Mangyongbong and the women's team of Kalmaegi.
					
					 The recent league matches marked an important occasion in further improving each team's technique and tactics.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful in Asian Youth Para Games
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful in Asian Youth Para Games 
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Players of the DPRK proved successful in the 3rd Asian Youth Para Games Malaysia 2013 held in Kuala Lumpur. 
					 The games brought together players from 42 countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					 Rim Ju Song took the second place in S6 men 100m freestyle and S6 men 100m backstroke, Ri Chol Song and Ma Yu Chol the second place in TT9 men's team table-tennis and Ri Chol Song third place in TT9  men's single table-tennis.

articles.title: Many People Assist Sepho Tableland Projet
articles.content:
Many People Assist Sepho Tableland Projet
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Sepho Tideland Project is progressing apace in the DPRK with the assistance from many people in the country.
					 The Ministry of Public Health provided the project with tractors, trailing farm machines, knapsack-style sprayers, a large quantity of fuel and grass seeds.
					
					 Officials of the ministry deem it one of their duties to look after the living of the families of its employees who left their homes to work at the project.
					
					North Hwanghae Province has paid close attention to assisting the project. 
					
					 Many families in the province have donated their domestic animals to those in the project.
					
					 The General Bureau of Public Service supplied the project with various kinds of vehicles, cement, steel and other materials.
					
					 A lot of people rendered aids to the project.
					
					 Among them are O Mi Hyang, an official of the C.C., the Architects Union of Korea, Son Un Hui, a worker of the Mangyongdae Children's Camp and O Chun Ok, a resident in the township of Jongphyong County, South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: River Improvement in Northern Part of DPRK
articles.content:
River Improvement in Northern Part of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- North Hamgyong Province in the northeastern part of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently readjusted 20-odd minor rivers and streams.
					 The province set it as a main goal for autumn land management to improve rivers and streams in cities and counties and concentrated its efforts on this improvement project.
					
					 Those in Yonsa County removed more than 4 000 cubic meters of earth from Yonmyon stream flowing through its township, adding to its scenery.
					
					 Musan County carried out much volume of earth from Songchon stream and successfully finished its embankment.
					
					 Hwadae and Kilju counties directed big efforts to reinforcing the embankment of Namdae stream. To this end, Kilju County removed 3 800 cubic meters of earth and carried out more than 1 500 square meters of embankment.
					
					 The city of Chongjin successfully conducted embankment project along the banks of Susong and Rabuk streams.

articles.title: Movable Net Ring Introduced in Breeding Fish in DPRK
articles.content:
Movable Net Ring Introduced in Breeding Fish in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang City Fish Farming Management Bureau has introduced movable net ring in breeding freshwater fish.
					 It began raising fish in an intensive way around Yanggak Islet on the Taedong River and in the waterway of the Pothong River with use of movable net rings of 250 square meters and 2 250 square meters respectively.
					
					 Such breeding method costs lower than in fish farms.
					
					 The production capacity of a 250-square-meter net ring is approximately three tons, tantamount to four times that in one hectare of fish farm.
					
					 The net ring can be moved to safe places during rainy season while being submerged in winter.
					
					 The method is divided into floating and stationary ones.
					
					 Kim Kwon Hwi, an official of the bureau, told KCNA that the method of fish breeding will be introduced in rivers and reservoirs across the country.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Kumgang (4)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Kumgang (4)
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Samsonam and Kwimyonam in the Manmulsang (myriad-shaped peaks) Valley of Mt. Kumgang tell about a legend well known among the local people.
					 Once upon a time, three wizards went sightseeing of sceneries across the land of Korea.
					
					 One day, they came to Mt. Kumgang after touring all of scenic spots throughout the country.
					
					 When they climbed up the mountain, fascinated by the scenery of Manmulsang, they happened to see some of fairies descending on a rainbow to one of rocks of Manmulsang.
					
					 They stopped climbing and enjoyed themselves seeing the fairies.
					
					 In the meantime, darkness began to land on the mountain and they walked back their way.
					
					 As they reached the entrance to Manmulsang, they suddenly came across some demons.
					
					 Amazed by the wizards, the demons ran away, with one of them standing still, overwhelmed by the wizards.
					
					 Abruptly, the demon turned to be a rock, which is now called Kwimyonam.
					
					 And the three wizards turned themselves into rocks as warriors likely to defend Manmulsang from the attack of the demons.
					
					 The rocks are now called Samsonam.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Regime to Abandon Its Bad Habit of Depending on Outsiders
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Regime to Abandon Its Bad Habit of Depending on Outsiders
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should abandon their bad habit of relying on outside forces, urges Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. 
					 It is an unpardonable act of treachery for the south Korean regime to stand in confrontation with compatriots in reliance upon outside forces, swimming against the trend of the times, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The south Korean regime is betraying the nation and increasing the danger of a nuclear war as a despicable lackey of the U.S. while introducing foreign aggressor forces into south Korea. These acts are throwing a stumbling block in the way of achieving the independent development of the nation and peace and reunification of the country. 
					
					 For the Koreans, the U.S. is the arch criminal which divided their country and inflicted misfortunes and disasters upon them and is blocking national reunification. The U.S. is the master and dominator of the ruling forces in south Korea. And the latter is no more than stooges and servants of the former. No one can become "president" of south Korea unless he is supported and approved by the U.S and the ruling forces in south Korea can neither speak nor behave as they please without reading the face of their U.S. master. This is their wretched plight.
					
					 Neither national reconciliation and unity of the nation can be achieved nor the inter-Korean relations be mended unless the puppet ruling forces roll back their treacherous policy of depending on outside forces and inciting confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 Only when they take such attitude as placing the nation above all, giving priority to it and making efforts to achieve its unity, can the inter-Korean relations be improved and an avenue be paved for peace and reunification of the country. It is foolish for them to try to settle the issue of north-south relations in reliance upon outsiders by negating the principle of independence.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group's "Election" Fraud Exposed
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group's "Election" Fraud Exposed
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary says the last "presidential election" in south Korea was, in fact, an illegal and lawless "election" coup, a typical government power-backed "election" by use of all means and methods and with all the puppet power organs involved.
					 Agents of the puppet Intelligence Service and the group of men engaged in a psychological war of the Cyber Command of the puppet army made up lots of false articles groundlessly slandering candidates from the opposition parties, branding them as "forces following the north" and posted them on internet, the commentary says, and notes:
					
					 The articles that were used as red herrings amount to 56 000 when counting only those that have been disclosed till now. Nearly 100 million U.S. dollars were spent for it.
					
					 Upset by the full disclosure of the dark inside story about the past "presidential election" that was rigged being backed by government power, the coteries of the "Saenuri Party" resorted to base acts to conceal the fraud-marred "election" in alignment with the IS and, at the same time, worked hard to get rid of the crisis by branding the opposition party forces as "forces rejecting the election results". The present puppet chief executive is feigning ignorance, claiming the case has nothing to do with her as it occurred during the past regime.
					
					 The last "presidential election" was the hideous power-backed fraud-tainted "election" unprecedented in history far exceeding the "March 15 fraudulent election".
					
					 On March 15, 1960 traitor Syngman Rhee conducted the fourth-term "presidential and vice-presidential elections" by committing terrorism and oppression and resorting to a whole gamut of irregularities and swindles to prop up power from collapsing.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Abandoning "Three Principles of Arms Export"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Abandoning "Three Principles of Arms Export"
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the intelligent men's council set up by the Japanese prime minister drew up an outline of the "state security strategy". The outline specified the reexamination of the "three principles of arms export" which bans the export of weapons and related technologies.
					 Japan is set to work out a final plan on the basis of the outline in the future, specify it in the new defense programme guidelines in December and decide on them at a Cabinet meeting.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Japan's scenario to discard the three principles which it has long observed and join in the international weapon development system is aimed to realize its wild ambition for turning Japan into a military giant.
					
					 It is the calculation of the Japanese reactionaries to boost the exchange of military technology and cooperation with other countries in an effort to possess ultra-modern military technological equipment and weapons necessary for turning Japan into a military power, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					  Japan is very busy drafting a bill related to the establishment of the National Security Council of Japanese style and adopting a bill on protecting specified secret.
					
					 Explaining the reason for their moves, the Japanese reactionaries claim that they are attributable to the worsening security situation in the areas around Japan due to "China's increasing military spending and north Korea's stepped-up nuclear development".
					
					 This is, however, nothing but sophism intended to justify their moves for turning Japan into a military power and launching overseas expansion.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are scheming to reorganize the state machinery into a wartime system in a bid to provide favorable conditions for provoking and waging a war.
					
					 Japan should cogitate about what consequences will be entailed by its reckless moves to bring war disasters to Asia again, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Worst Human Rights Abuser 
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed without let-up that the U.S. wiretapped other countries regularly and indiscriminately, stunning the world. 
					 According to the disclosures, the U.S. has constantly wiretapped tens of millions of private e-mails worldwide. 
					
					 Under the surveillance plan titled "Prism", last year alone the National Security Agency of the U.S. wiretapped at least 250 million private e-mails on the special watch list, 500 000 on a daily average, in different parts of the world. 
					
					 Included among the targets of eavesdropping were foreign heads of state and other politicians from such friendly countries of the U.S. as Germany, France and Italy, the Pope and other dignitaries, foreign state institutions, the headquarters of EU, International Atomic Energy Agency and other international organizations. 
					
					 In a recent month alone there were 60 million cases of wiretapping in the U.S. and 500 million cases in Germany. This fact fully reveals the true colors of the U.S. as the worst abuser of human rights. 
					
					 To wiretap the secret of communications including private messages to be observed strictly represents the worst abuse of human rights ignoring the elementary conception of human rights.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. that does the worst things in the world, seriously infringing upon human rights in all countries of the world including its friendly countries to meet its interests. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. shamelessly justifies its wiretapping which gets evermore undisguised. 
					
					 Some time ago, the White House said that the U.S. president did not know about the spying cases including wiretapping of foreign leaders made by the NSA. 
					
					 When the accusing finger was pointed at them in the wake of ceaseless disclosures, the former and incumbent officials concerned of the NSA and CIA, which have served the chief executives, could not but admit that they received the instructions for wiretapping dozens of foreign state leaders directly from the White House and the Department of State. Much upset by this, the U.S. secretary of State said that there was no other option but to continue "security service" including wiretapping round the clock and for 365 days as there were a lot of forces to hurt Americans in different parts of the world. The director of the NSA justified the wiretapping, claiming that it was inevitable to "combat terrorism." 
					
					 The U.S. claim that the illegal wiretapping is to "combat terrorism" is nothing but an absurd pretext. 
					
					 The aim of the U.S. large-scale wiretapping overseas is obviously to watch and spy on every move of other countries to realize world domination. 
					
					 The U.S. espionage including wiretapping for aggression and domination is now being perpetrated in different countries of the world.
					
					 Wiretapping is playing a big role in the U.S. moves for aggression to attain its goal for dominating other countries by gathering secrets of different fields including politics, military and economy. 
					
					 The NSA wiretaps voices, photos, e-mails and others by setting up the program called "Prism" in the worldwide internet servers under the pretext of "anti-terrorism". It also watches computers and phone messages in the world by use of the software "information server without borders". 
					
					 An official of the NSA openly said that the NSA hears voices of the presidents of any countries. 
					
					 For its human rights abuse through wiretapping, the U.S. is now standing further isolated, censured even by its allies including Saudi Arabia, U.K., Italy, France and Germany. 
					
					 It is quite natural that the U.S. is cursed and condemned by the world people.

articles.title: Punishment of Those Involved in Interference in Election Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Those Involved in Interference in Election Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Catholics of south Korea  held a prayer meeting on the situation in Seoul on Oct. 30 demanding the probe into the truth about the case of the puppet power organs' interference in the election and the punishment of  criminals.
					  Speakers said that they could not pardon Park Geun Hye for concealing the crimes committed during the past election and cracking down on people critical of them by labeling them "forces following the north". 
					
					 In order to probe the truth about the case it is imperative to make a special inspection for conducting independent investigation free from any outside pressure, the speakers held.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Revive Militarism Flayed
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Revive Militarism Flayed
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Sonu Hak Won, a Korean scholar in the U.S., contributed an article titled "We cannot pardon Japan's moves to revive militarism" to Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S.
					 The article citied historic data to expose that the war criminals of Japan escaped punishment under the U.S. patronage after the end of World War II.
					
					 Japan is now becoming all the more undisguised in its moves to remove the Pacifist Constitution and turn itself into a military giant, and it is supported by the U.S. behind the scene, the article charged.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime and the "Saenuri Party" fail to properly understand the danger of such plot, it said, and went on:
					
					 Japan insists that Tok Islets are part of its territory, its politicians throng to Yasukuni Shrine and justify the crimes committed by it during its war of aggression, far from apologizing for them. This is little short of clarifying its clear stand that it would revive militarism.
					
					 We can never pardon Japan's revival of militarism.

articles.title: Tokyo Metropolitan Authorities Accused of Their Undisguised Discrimination against Koreans
articles.content:
Tokyo Metropolitan Authorities Accused of Their Undisguised Discrimination against Koreans
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Against the backdrop of the worsening discrimination of the Japanese government against Korean schools in Japan the Tokyo Metropolitan authorities on Nov. 1 announced a step of not including subsidies to Korean schools in the metropolitan budget for 2014.
					 In a press conference the governor of Tokyo Metropolis made the absurd remarks that to pay subsidies to Korean schools cannot get understanding of the metropolitan people.
					
					 The metropolis has suspended since 2010 the payment of subsidies to Korean schools, pursuant to the Japanese government's discriminating policy regarding the aid program for Korean schools. It had paid subsidies to foreign schools since1995.
					
					 The Japanese government's undisguised national discrimination is sparking off the towering resentment of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: South Korean Regime's Crackdown upon Progressive Party Rapped in Benin, Bulgaria
articles.content:
South Korean Regime's Crackdown upon Progressive Party Rapped in Benin, Bulgaria
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Political parties of Benin and Bulgaria issued statements on October 28 and 29 accusing the south Korean puppet group of suppressing a progressive political party.
					 The Socialist Party of Benin branded the south Korean puppet group's moves to forcibly disband the Unified Progressive Party (UPP), a legitimate political party, as an unprecedented fascist action.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The progressive political parties are being incriminated and suppressed and a campaign is being kicked up to forcibly disband them in south Korea. What does it show?
					
					 This goes to prove that south Korea today is a political doldrums and society under the reign of fascism where the political freedom and right are ruthlessly violated.
					
					 We appeal to all the progressive political parties of the world which set store by democracy and justice to become increasingly vocal condemning the south Korean conservative group's moves to disband the UPP.
					
					 The Bulgarian Communists Union expressed great concern about the evermore undisguised crackdown upon the progressive party desirous of justice and truth in south Korea. It went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are pursuing confrontation with compatriots in the north, while kowtowing to the U.S., their master. With no rhetoric can they justify this behavior.
					
					 This indicates that they are denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration which indicate the way of achieving national reconciliation and reunification.
					
					 We vehemently assail the moves of the south Korean authorities to forcibly disband the UPP and demand they immediately stop their crackdown upon the progressive parties contrary to democracy.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Junket to UK Slammed by British Organization
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Junket to UK Slammed by British Organization 
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on October 30 in protest against the south Korean chief executive's junket to Britain.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Park Geun Hye is turning south Korea into a land of darkness under the reign of fascism just as Park Chung Hee did.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are now working hard to forcibly disband the Unified Progressive Party (UPP), a progressive political party.
					
					 In south Korea there is the "National Security Law," a copy of the evil law dating back to the period of the Japanese imperialist rule and this law prohibits not only all activities of the left-wing political parties but activities praising the DPRK.
					
					 South Korea is a colony of the U.S. as it has no right to command wartime operations.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is openly talking about a preemptive strike at the DPRK after working out the "tailored deterrence strategy" with the U.S.
					
					 As soon as Park took office in south Korea ceaseless war exercises have been staged with the U.S. and even U.S. nuclear strategic bombers are flying into the air over the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We call upon the progressive people of Britain to oppose Park's junket to Britain and put pressure upon the south Korean fascist regime to step down.

articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Supported by British Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Supported by British Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a joint statement on October 24 in support of the DPRK Foreign Ministry spokesman's statement issued on October 23. 
					 The statement said that it is none other than the U.S. that is throwing a wet blanket over the fair and aboveboard proposal of the DPRK which loves peace more than any other country.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The U.S. is running the whole gamut of hostile provocations against the DPRK as evidenced by the introduction of its nuclear-powered carrier into the waters off the Korean Peninsula from its invariable hostile policy toward the latter.
					
					 This is a grave threat to the DPRK's sovereignty and peace in the Asia-Pacific region, an indication that the "peaceful co-existence" touted by the U.S. is nothing but a hypocritical ploy.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. which spawned the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula by shipping nukes into south Korea in wanton violation of the Korean Armistice Agreement. 
					
					 It was the U.S. aggressive and hostile policy toward the DPRK that compelled the latter to have access to nuclear deterrent.
					
					 It is, therefore, preposterous for the U.S. to force the DPRK to dismantle its nukes.
					
					 The U.S. is making desperate efforts to disarm the DPRK but this is a serious miscalculation.
					
					 The U.S. demand for the DPRK's unilateral dismantlement of its nukes is nothing but an intrigue to stifle socialist Korea of Juche centered on the popular masses. 
					
					 If the U.S. truly stands for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, it should defuse its nuclear threat to the DPRK and immediately withdraw all its aggressor forces from south Korea.
					
					 We are of the view that it is entirely just for the DPRK to bolster up its war deterrent.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces under Fire by Russian, British Papers
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces under Fire by Russian, British Papers
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Russian and British papers carried articles lashing out at the south Korean puppet conservative forces for working hard to forcibly dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Russian paper Bremya Peremon Plus TV on October 30 accused the present conservative forces and gentries of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea of their moves to forcibly disorganize the UPP.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Such moves show the height of mean and fascist politically-motivated farce of the present conservative ruling forces to indiscriminately suppress even the legitimate political parties and organizations in a bid to satisfy their greed for long-term office and attain their political purpose.
					
					 The present situation is not that early in the 20th century when the world was swept by a violent storm of fascism against communism. 
					
					 However, in south Korea under the colonial fascist rule outdated evil laws ride roughshod, wantonly violating elementary freedom and rights of human beings and unhesitatingly perpetrating persecution and crackdown on political parties standing against the "government."
					
					 South Korea, in a word, is a political doldrums under the reign of fascism where political freedom and rights of people are ruthlessly violated.
					
					 Worse still, the puppet conservative forces are misleading public opinion, branding the UPP as  the "forces keen to bring down the social system linked with the north" and its programme as the "disguised north's programme", in a bid to  justify their sordid political plot.
					
					 Political parties and organizations of various circles in south Korea can achieve democracy and bring earlier the day of national reunification only when they wage a positive struggle against the harsh fascist repressive campaign of the puppet conservative group to stamp out justice and progress.
					
					 The fair public and political parties of the world that set store by democracy and justice should pay due attention to the grave situation in south Korea and become increasingly vocal expressing solidarity.
					
					 The October-November issue of the British paper Proletarian in an article titled "The Unified Progressive Party subject to suppression in south Korea" said that if the just programme of a party becomes a reason for politically-motivated suppression, this brings into bolder relief the hypocritical nature of democracy in south Korean society and dictatorial nature of the present "government."

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Moving to Disband UPP
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Moving to Disband UPP
 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Thai organizations made public statements on October 30 in denunciation of the south Korean conservative group for moving to forcibly dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand said that south Korea is going back to the period of dictatorial rule when fascism and illegality were rampant, denouncing the moves of the conservative ruling forces and the "Saenuri Party" to disband the UPP.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 South Koreans should not remain a passive onlooker to the moves but actively combat them.
					
					 Fair world public valuing democracy and justice has to continue the push to decisively check them.
					
					 The Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association noted that south Korea has now turned into a political tundra of fascism where political freedom and rights of people are ruthlessly violated.
					
					 Political parties in any country are guaranteed freedom of activities and left-wing political parties are legitimately active even in capitalist countries in the West, it said.
					
					 It appealed to the progressives in the world loving democracy and justice to prevent the south Korean conservative forces from stamping out the UPP.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Pyong Ryul
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Pyong Ryul
						
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio este martes una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Pyong Ryul, miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y asesor del Tribunal Supremo, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las gestiones del Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang.
					Tras recorrer varios puntos, el convoco una reunion de consulta.
					
					En la ocasion se hizo enfasis en registrar innovacion en la generacion de energia electrica al hacer a los funcionarios organizar y dirigir bien la produccion movilizando a los obreros deseosos de aumentarla.
					
					Se tomaron las medidas para exigir a los sectores relacionados que eleven su papel.
					
					A continuacion, tuvo lugar en la Mina de Carbon de Jenam del Complejo Carbonifero de la Zona de Tokchon una reunion consultiva de los funcionarios para enviar suficiente cantidad de carbon al Complejo Termoelectrico.
					
					Se resalto la necesidad de cumplir sin falta el plan de produccion de carbon por cada mes y trimestre, de modo que se aumentara la produccion electrica y se mejoraran los niveles de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier organizo otra reunion en el Complejo Quimico de Sunchon y discutio las medidas para normalizar la produccion y hacer a las unidades relacionadas suministrar las materias primas y materiales necesarios.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con delegacion gubernamental de Sudafrica
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con delegacion gubernamental de Sudafrica 
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, departio este martes en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica de Sudafrica presidida por el viceministro de Relaciones Internacionales y Cooperacion, Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador portugues
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador portugues
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Antonio Quinteiro Nobre presento este martes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, las cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Portugal en Corea. 
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Nuevo embajador coreano presenta cartas credenciales a presidenta de Brasil
articles.content:
Nuevo embajador coreano presenta cartas credenciales a presidenta de Brasil
						
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Thae Jong presento el dia 31 ante  la presidenta de la Republica Federativa de Brasil, Dilma Vana Rousseff, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en ese pais carioca.
					En la ocasion la presidenta brasilena deseo de todo corazon que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises seguiran desarrollandose favorablemente tambien en el futuro.

articles.title: Firmada nota de entendimiento entre las fiscalias de Corea y China
articles.content:
Firmada nota de entendimiento entre las fiscalias de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricada en Beijing la nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion entre la Fiscalia Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Fiscalia Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular China.
					La firmaron el primer vicepresidente de la Fiscalia Suprema de la RPDC, Ri Chol, y el fiscal general adjunto ejecutivo de la Fiscalia Popular Suprema de la RPCh, Hu Zejun.
